column1: Your body needs potassium to: - Build proteins - Break down and use carbohydrates - Build muscle - Maintain normal body growth - Control the electrical activity of the heart - Control the acid-base balance
All meats (red meat and chicken) and fish such as salmon, cod, flounder, and sardines are good sources of potassium.

You may have hypokalemia if you: - Take diuretics (water pills) to treat high blood pressure or heart failure - Take too many laxatives - Have severe or prolonged vomiting and diarrhea - Have certain kidney or adrenal gland disorders Too much potassium in the blood is known as hyperkalemia.
